Sentencas: Carbon removal from the anode triple-phase boundary (TPB) of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) by adsorbed water molecule was studied using the density functional calculations, and a detailed dynamic picture was presented.
Titulo: The origin of the low efficiency of carbon removal from the Nickel/Yttrium-Stabilized Zirconia triple-phase boundary by adsorbed water

Sentencas: It is found that the adsorbed H2O molecule can dissociate easily at the Ni/YSZ interface and on the YSZ part compared with the Ni part and react with the interface carbon to form the CHO species.
Titulo: The origin of the low efficiency of carbon removal from the Nickel/Yttrium-Stabilized Zirconia triple-phase boundary by adsorbed water

Sentencas: The dissociation process of CHO to CH and 0 is more favorable as compared with that of CHO to CO and H. The CH fragment can easily diffuse to the 0 vacancy formed in the dynamic reaction processes and dissociate into C and H, which regenerates carbon at the interface.
Titulo: The origin of the low efficiency of carbon removal from the Nickel/Yttrium-Stabilized Zirconia triple-phase boundary by adsorbed water

Sentencas: This might be the main reasons for the low efficiency of carbon removal from the TPB of Ni/YSZ by adsorbed water.
Titulo: The origin of the low efficiency of carbon removal from the Nickel/Yttrium-Stabilized Zirconia triple-phase boundary by adsorbed water
